title: Antica Fratta 2013 Essence Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Elegantly sparkling, this offers aromas suggesting dried orchard fruit and bread crust that carry over to the palate along with yellow apple and citrus. Bright acidity and a creamy mousse provide the backdrop.

title: Ayoub 2015 Brittan Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This vineyard emphasizes rather steely mineral-driven flavors. The fruit is ripened in an austere mode, firm and sculpted, with flavors of wild mountain berry. A whiff of tobacco follows through, with a similar vein in the finish. It's a dense wine that will reward aggressive decanting.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Graacher Himmelreich Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Plump yellow cherry, peach and apricot abound in this juicy, deeply concentrated kabinett. It's an intensely sun-kissed, almost tropical wine but light as a feather on the palate and deftly balanced by spine tingling acidity.

title: Dr. Hermann 2016 Erdener Prälat Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: While smoky and earthen on the nose, the palate of this light-footed auslese is plush, almost fleshy, with unctuous yellow-peach, mango and tangerine flavors. Racy lime acidity revitalizes the midpalate, leading to a long, clean finish. Drink now through 2025.

title: Fram 2015 Shiraz (Swartland)
description: This is an expressive yet well-balanced wine, with wonderful interplay between the dense black-fruit characteristics. Brambly boysenberry, blackberry and cherry meld seamlessly with notes of sweet spice, purple violets, game and white pepper. The palate's slightly creamy texture is countered by framing tannins that lend grip and structure through the finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Gianfranco Fino 2015 Jo Negroamaro (Salento)
description: Named after the latin name of the Ionian sea (Jonio), this single-variety Negroamaro has a dense, permeating nose of jammy red and black berries, tobacco leaf, crushed cocoa nibs and graphite. Firmly medium in weight, the palate shows a vibrant force of tart berries and game that turns richer and riper come the midpalate, translating as a lingering red cherry note on the finish. Sandy tannins offer plenty of grip, yet the bright acidity and pervasive fruit tones keep everything in check.

title: Guado al Melo 2016 Criseo White (Bolgheri)
description: Made primarily with Vermentino, this opens with delicate scents of white spring flower, yellow stone fruit, citrus and a whiff of honey. Mirroring the nose, the fresh enveloping palate doles out dried apricot, juicy nectarine drop and a honeyed mineral note alongside tangy acidity. Hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2021.

title: Gypsy Dancer 2014 Legacy Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Plum, sweet cinnamon and cardamom are gracefully threaded through the core of brambly berry fruit. Aged for 11 months in barrel, it finishes with a streak of vanilla.

title: JCP Maltus 2015 Château Laforge  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Firm tannins are well integrated with the black-currant fruits in this dense, ripe and very fruity wine. It is juicy and perfumed with a generous texture and good freshness. The Merlot sings in this wine, bright and structured. Drink from 2021.

title: Kaena 2015 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's strong woody spice on the nose of this appellation blend with sandalwood and lacquer aromas meeting with stewed plums, mulberries and candied flowers. Those same fruit flavors show on the sip, alongside a pine-needle lift. It is a quite rich expression.

title: Kerloo 2015 Calling Club Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This 100% varietal wine is a blend of fruit from top sites Klipsun (60%) and Dioynsus. Baking spice, herb, cocoa, tobacco, espresso and cherry aromas lead to suave, silky cherry and cocoa flavors. Like the vintage it came from, it holds nothing back. The oak (65% new French) is a bit up front at present but should integrate with additional time in bottle. Best after 2020.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Trois Châteaux Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The vanilla and wood scent of new oak is evident on the nose. On the palate this is more integrated, the fine wood notes intertwining with the ripe cherry fruit. The tannin structure is fine and firm, supported by vivid freshness. This is lovely now but will mellow over the coming years. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Longoria 2016 Clover Creek Vineyard Albariño (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Plump aromas of poached pear, Meyer lemon pith, honeysuckle and an underlying slate-like minerality hit the nose on this bottling. There's a roundness to the palate of Asian pear, but the sip is all about grippy texture and sizzling citrus energy that carries deep into the finish.

title: Mira 2013 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made version of the variety, 100% in this case. Earthy tobacco, clove and dusty oak ride along seamless tannin structure and plenty of length and breadth. Balanced within a full-bodied sense of powerful weight and presence, it softens on the finish to reveal lighter touches of pencil shavings and clove.

title: Paul Cluver 2015 Seven Flags Chardonnay (Elgin)
description: A rich and toasty wine, this opens with abundant aromas of baked apple, honey-roasted nuts, lemon oil and ginger-clove orange peel. The medium-weight palate is round and mouthfilling, but with superb acidity to balance, lifting the ripe fruit flavors and lending a saline lift to the finish. Drink this well-balanced beauty now–2024.

title: Plozza 2013 RedEdition  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This opens with aromas of woodland berry, alpine herb, menthol and whiffs of oak-driven spice. The elegant precise palate delivers sour cherry, cranberry, star anise and a hint of salty mineral set against a backbone of fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. It's still youthfully austere and needs time to fully develop. Drink 2021–2031.

title: Recanati 2014 Special Reserve Red (Galilee)
description: This dark garnet colored wine has aromas of black cherry and a faint touch of green bell pepper. Sleek tannins coat the palate as flavors of black cherry, raspberry, smoke, black pepper and eucalyptus cavort towards a lasting, smoky finish.

title: Ricci Curbastro 2009 Gualberto Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: Brioche, toasted nut, acacia honey and dried apricot aromas follow through to the dry vibrant palate along with yellow apple, nectarine and hint of exotic spice. Bright acidity and a refined perlage provide the backbone while a bitter-almond note marks the close.

title: Robert Weil 2016 Tradition Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Orange blossoms and crushed mineral tones perfume this delicately off-dry Riesling. Light bodied and spry, the palate is taut, with deeply penetrating high-toned acidity and crunchy peach, tangerine and lemon flavors. Finishes long on notes of lemon zest, fennel and crushed earth.

title: Smoking Gun 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed lavender opens the way to a softly layered, structured wine that's medium bodied and restrained in tone. Cassis and red cherry are matched by bright, lingering acidity that provides a welcome succulence throughout.

title: Snake and Herring 2014 Dirty Boots Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: A typical yet classy example of Margaret River, this wine dishes up notes of dark cherry, currant, tobacco, mocha, eucalyptus and dried green herbs. The medium-bodied palate has soft but chewy tannins, with some apparent oak components and a dark-cherry and green-tinged finish. It's elegant and soft enough to drink now but will age well through 2028.

title: Spier 2015 Vintage Collection Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: Quite pronounced in tropical fruit and floral aromas, this opens with attractive scents of pressed buttercup, honeysuckle and lime lead that frame the guava, pineapple rind and red apple fruit core. Those ripe-fruit tones carry through to the medium-weight palate, with bright, orange-laced acidity to lift. A final note of delicate sweet spice on the way back of the close. Drink now–2022.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This red embraces its main variety's ancestral home, blending in 12% Syrah, 10% Grenache and a pinch of other Rhône reds. Peppery and tannic, it shines in blueberry, cedar, dried herb and cinnamon, begging for more time in the bottle. Enjoy best 2019 through 2029.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Esprit Blanc de Tablas White (Adelaida District)
description: Lemon butter and plump pineapple aromas are cut by crushed gravel and an edgy citrus peel character on the nose of this blend of 55% Roussanne, 28% Grenache Blanc and 17% Picpoul Blanc. The Roussanne provides a rich midpalate, full of fleshy but not overripe baked apple flavors, dusted with baking spice and leveled by buoyant acidity.

title: Thanisch 2016 Lieserer Niederberg Helden Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Hits of exotic spice and salt accent rich, ripe streaks of peach, yellow cherry and tangerine in this decadent spätlese. Despite its lavish ripeness, it's a sprightly, revitalizing wine, with zesty acidity and a cool, mineral finish. Drink now through 2025.

title: TW Ferm Co. 2014 Cultivator Red (Paso Robles)
description: This small-production wine (just 22 cases) is a blend of 53% Malbec, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot that spent 32 months in 35% new French oak. Aromas of caramel, chocolate cake and black cherry are cut by a minty lift. The palate shows similar weight and richness, with flavors of baked strawberry, cinnamon and caramel sauce. It's soft on the palate and chalky in texture, boasting a  butterscotch finish.

title: Villa Creek 2015 Garnacha (Paso Robles)
description: Red and purple flowers meet with crushed slate, turned soil and plump cherry fruits on the nose of this bottling. It's a solid, down-the-middle expression of the grape, with red and black plums, clove and tarragon lifts to the palate.

title: Weingut Albert Gessinger 2016 Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Josefberg Old Vines Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate hints of clay and crushed earth lend savory complexity to this otherwise wildly fruity spätlese. It's unctuously ripe offering loads of summery peach and nectarine flavors but balanced by a spine tingling lemon-lime finish. Drink now through 2025.
designation: Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Josefberg Old Vines Spätlese

title: Wrath 2015 Alta Loma Vineyard Grenache (Monterey)
description: Rounded and ripe aromas of baked strawberry, red plum, dried rose petal and anise show on the nose of this bottling by theater tech-turned-winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The complex texture is still a bit stiff and sticky on the palate, and the flavors are strong and straightforward, with cranberry and sandalwood. It's clean and refreshing overall, but it could use more time.

title: Bollig-Lehnert 2016 Dhroner Hofberger Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Savory tones of smoke and crushed earth permeate from nose to finish, suggesting a complex auslese that's more mineral than fruit. Still, vibrant lemon-lime acidity and silken streaks of honey penetrate the midpalate and extend through a long, invigorating finish. It drinks well now but should show even better from 2021.
